intro: Psychotria lovettii, commonly known as the Lovett's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Psychotria lovettii is often found in shaded understory environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
